intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion montis-porrarae, commonly known as the Porran Hill hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium montis-porrarae is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh mountain climates.
